qrapp.title: QRapp
qrapp.description: QRapp is all about making QR code hunting fun and social! You can collect codes, compete with friends for top spots on various leaderboards, or just enjoy spotting codes everywhere you go. Whether you're into casual collecting or serious competition, there's something here for you.

technologies.Android Studio: Used for frontend development and connecting to the backend.
technologies.GitHub: Used for version control, documentation, and task management.

contributions: Documented all work on GitHub and the GitHub wiki.
Designed storyboards for use cases and user experiences.
Developed the map feature, including its UI/UX design.
Developed the ranking system and leaderboard pages.
Planned and set up app layout and navigation.
qrapp.bestFeatures: The app's user interface and performance are top-notch. We put a lot of effort into making it visually appealing and engaging. It's definitely one of the most beautifully designed apps I've worked on.

aranimal.title: AR Animal Identification
aranimal.description: This app is part of a project by Aquatic Biosphere, aimed at raising awareness and funds for the Albertan Biosphere. It pairs with a vinyl sticker showcasing local organisms. Users can identify and learn about these creatures through interactive games and activities. The app also features easy customization for admins to update information.

technologies.Flutter: For frontend development and connecting to the backend.
technologies.FastAPI: Creates API endpoints for image recognition and database interactions.
technologies.Uvicorn: Serves and deploys APIs for image recognition and user interactions.
technologies.GitHub: Handles version control, documentation, and task management.
technologies.VuePress: Used for creating a website with full project documentation.

contributions: Documented work on GitHub and VuePress.
Took meeting minutes and kept documentation.
Designed use cases and user experiences.
Developed image recognition with OpenCV and integrated it into the app.
Designed and planned games and activities.
Created game-related pages and control logic.
aranimal.bestFeatures: The app’s cross-platform compatibility is a highlight. It works well on various devices, including older phones, and is accessible on both Android and iOS. It’s all about making the app as inclusive as possible.

proquest.title: ProQuest
proquest.description: ProQuest helps agents find the best teams and scouts find top players. Users can add players and teams, track performance, and test out different tactics in the planner. It’s all about showcasing talent and strategic planning.

technologies.Figma: Used for wireframing, prototyping, and storyboarding.
technologies.TailwindCSS: A CSS framework for styling and design.
technologies.Vite: A build tool for setting up React projects.
technologies.React: JavaScript library for building user interfaces.
technologies.Node: Runtime environment for executing JavaScript outside the browser.
technologies.Render: Cloud platform for serving and deploying APIs.
technologies.Netlify: Deploys frontend applications and manages web projects.
technologies.GitHub: Version control for source code, documentation, and task management.

proquest.bestFeatures: I'm proud of several features: the multi-filtration system on the Players Page, dynamic CSS for different screen sizes, and the planner page where users can create and share their team setups. The planner page, in particular, offers a lot of fun and customization options.
